sentences.en: ...fighting which followed the partition of India.
...new offices divided only by glass partitions.
sentences.cn: …仅仅用玻璃隔板隔开的新办公室。

sentences.en: Britain was accused of trying to partition the country "because of historic enmity"
sentences.cn: 英国被指“出于历史仇恨”企图分裂该国。

sentences.en: But such a location had more often led to partition than to independence.
sentences.cn: 然而这样的位量往往导致瓜分而不是独立.

sentences.en: For many people there was no fine partition between art and propaganda.
sentences.cn: 对许多人来说,艺术和宣传是划不清界线的.

sentences.en: He moved carefully over what remained of partition walls.
sentences.cn: 他小心翼翼地跨过残余的隔墙。

sentences.en: I knew immediately that she was my housemate on the other side of the partition.
sentences.cn: 一见了她的容貌我就知道她是我的间壁的同居者了.

sentences.en: N is not the smallest possible value for a legal partition.
sentences.cn: 对合理分化,N不是最小的可能值.

sentences.en: She tapped on the glass partition and the car stopped.
sentences.cn: 她轻轻敲击玻璃隔板,汽车便停了下来.

sentences.en: The air cell partition become indistinct.
The builder wedges the wooden partition to the overhead construction.
sentences.cn: 建筑工人把木隔板?a在顶部的结构上.

sentences.en: The foundations of partition calculus were laid down over twenty years ago by Erdos and Rado.
sentences.cn: 划分学的基础大约是在二十多年以前由Erdos和Rado奠定的.

sentences.en: The frosted - glass partition in the alcove slid back and a pair of eyes scrutinized me carefully.
sentences.cn: 接待室的毛玻璃挡板拉开了,有一双眼睛仔细地审视着我.

sentences.en: The internal partition function is frequently simply called the partition function or also the state sum.
sentences.cn: 内配分函数往往简称配分函数,也可称为态和.

sentences.en: the partition of Germany after the war
The subsets in a partition are called cells.
sentences.cn: 划分中的各子集被称为单元.

sentences.en: We may partition matrices by drawing horizontal and vertical lines between the rows and columns.
sentences.cn: 我们也可以将矩阵分块,即在行以及列之间画一些水平线和垂直线.

words.tran_cn: 分开（part的过去式及过去分词）
划分（partition的过去分词）；分割；把…分成部分

phrases.tran_cn: 分配比，分配系数；分隔比

trans.tran_cn: 划分，分开，分割，隔离物，隔墙
trans.tran_en: the action of separating a country into two or more independent countries
to divide a country, building, or room into two or more parts
to divide a country, building, or room into two or more parts
